required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Disease Risk in Women With Endometriosis
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Disease Risk in Women With Endometriosis

brief_summary.textblock: To test the hypothesis that estrogen suppression impairs endothelial dysfunction in endometriosis.

detailed_description.textblock: Our scientific premise is that in women with endometriosis, elevated cardiovascular disease risk is the result of endothelial dysfunction and chronic systemic inflammation through lectin-like oxidized low-density lipoprotein receptor-1 (LOX-1) receptor activation. This cardiovascular disease risk is exacerbated by standard estrogen suppression treatments.

study_design_info.masking_description: no masking, all subjects have endometriosis

primary_outcome.measure: Flow Mediated Vasodilation Microvascular skin blood flow analysis
primary_outcome.description: Blood flow velocity will be measured using the Sonoscope S2 ultrasound imaging system.

primary_outcome.measure: Flow Mediated Vasodilation Microvascular skin blood flow analysis
primary_outcome.description: Brachial artery diameter will be measured using the Sonoscope S2 ultrasound imaging system.
Following recovery from the microdialysis probe insertions we will measure resting skin blood flow (SkBF).

arm_group.description: Control subjects will be healthy women, with regular menses every 26-34 days. Subjects will be excluded if they have any symptoms of endometriosis, including severe dysmenorrhea or progressive cyclic pelvic pain or prior surgery showing evidence of endometriosis

Endometriosis will be diagnosed by history of the disease seen at the time of prior surgery or will be diagnosed by classic clinical symptoms of the disease (cyclic progressive pelvic pain) using prior surgical report reviewed by Dr. Taylor.

intervention.description: Ganirelix acetate alone, 250 Î¼g/day in 0.5 ml normal saline,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Young women between the ages of 18 and 45 years (Controls);
- Young women between the ages of 18 and 45 years with endometriosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who smoke
- Subjects who have diabetes,
- Subjects with sleep apnea or BP>140/90 will be excluded.
- Women with endometriosis and severe acute pain requiring immediate treatment will be excluded.
